title: markvin
author: markvin
content: Has anyone dealt with crypto-arbitrage? Is it really such a profitable thing? And how difficult and risky is it? I 'm asking cause I talked to the guys from the firm, so they offer 20% per month. So I'm thinking, should I go try it myself or work with them? If anyone is wondering what i'm talking about, here's the link: https://intelfin.io/

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Never heard of this website I check them they offer "Income up to 22.4% per month" which is very high but there is no guarantee that you can actually make money from them. From what I can see they do offer their trading bot as an investment and promises you to make a profit.But the fact is this kind of strategy is the same as other investment sites. They offer an attractive profit but if you invest in the latter, you are scammed.I suggest you stay away from them and instead of giving them links here on the forum put them inside the insert code tag or remove HTTPS on the link so that it won't rank up on Google and to avoid new users clicking that site. A bit check of your post history it seems that you already have a thread about this why don't you read your old thread instead. Do you own this website?To prove that you don't own this website remove all links to that website here on the forum instead put only the name.

comments.author: logfiles
comments.created_time: July 16, 2022, 09:49:07 PMLast edit: July 16, 2022, 10:00:43 PM by logfiles
comments.body: Quote from: BitMaxz on July 14, 2022, 11:38:48 PMA bit check of your post history it seems that you already have a thread about this why don't you read your old thread instead. Do you own this website?To prove that you don't own this website remove all links to that website here on the forum instead put only the name. He's trying to indirectly advertise the website, which I think is a scam. People gave him opinions in different threads, but it looks like he is looking for praises about his website.He has spammed different boards “asking for opinions” about his site. I am going to flag the profile.Post history archive: https://ninjastic.space/user/id/3485188?topics

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: Quote from: logfiles on July 16, 2022, 09:49:07 PMHe's trying to indirectly advertise the website, which I think is a scam. People gave him opinions in different threads, but it looks like he is looking for praises about his website.He has spammed different boards “asking for opinions” about his site. I am going to flag the profile.Post history archive: https://ninjastic.space/user/id/3485188?topicsI thought he had given up, but he was still persistent. I give them a red tag also and support your flag. this section (Project development) should really allow to show the user's trust rating. it would be much easier to ignore such spammers.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Quote from: logfiles on July 16, 2022, 09:49:07 PMHe has spammed different boards “asking for opinions” about his site. I am going to flag the profile.Post history archive: https://ninjastic.space/user/id/3485188?topicsI would have clicked on the link, thanks for the warning, these accounts are getting really good at crafting stories so that it looks like real and even though I'm using a VPN but I'm starting to see they can get some information and with a little diligence in the responses these sites may collect a lot of information About you.

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: If those arbitrage opportunities were so profitable, you wouldn't need to shill your website here. In fact, you would keep it to yourself and only involve close friends and family to take advantage of the offers. But since that isn't the case, you need "investments" (deposits by us that will never be returned) and you are not going to get those here.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Quote from: BirdsOfRainbow on July 22, 2022, 02:49:53 PM seems to be legit. the website is arbismart.com, I have nothing to do with them. Always do your homework it is your money your decision. You wanted my personal experience here it is.Registers an account on Bitcointalk and immediately posts about his "personal experience" with arbismart.com that  no one asked about, and then logs out. Of course, you have something to do with the shady website, scam bug.

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: Quote from: Bitcoin_Arena on July 28, 2022, 10:49:58 PMRegisters an account on Bitcointalk and immediately posts about his "personal experience" with arbismart.com that  no one asked about, and then logs out. Of course, you have something to do with the shady website, scam bug.Yep, an instant red flag. Anyway, I checked that arbismart.com and this sentence will tell you everything that you have to know about that service "Annual interest rates reach up to 49% on all fiat orcryptocurrencies aside from RBIS, which offers unmatched rates of up to 147%!" So, Luna and Celsius couldn't handle giving 10-20% interest yet arbismart offers up to 49% on fiat. This can only end in one way.

comments.author: coin-investor
comments.body: Quote from: logfiles on July 16, 2022, 09:49:07 PMQuote from: BitMaxz on July 14, 2022, 11:38:48 PMA bit check of your post history it seems that you already have a thread about this why don't you read your old thread instead. Do you own this website?To prove that you don't own this website remove all links to that website here on the forum instead put only the name. He's trying to indirectly advertise the website, which I think is a scam. People gave him opinions in different threads, but it looks like he is looking for praises about his website.He has spammed different boards “asking for opinions” about his site. I am going to flag the profile.Post history archive: https://ninjastic.space/user/id/3485188?topicsSupporting the flag, reading this tread I thought he was asking for an honest opinion about a particular site not after I read all the member's other opinions on this thread, these promoters are getting clever, you thought it was a harmless opinion about the site, but this is Bitcointalk, people here will not only give their opinion but will dig deeper and further, check your profile, check your posting history and check the link you've posted, once caught you get will red tag and flagged.

comments.author: KingsDen
comments.body: I saw that OP is not genuine and he has been rightly tagged by DT members. Then I want to still say something because some newbies whose spirit of lossing money is following would still be tempted to open the link and invest. Any investment promising you high RoI is a scam. They don't produce money or mint coins, there's no way a legit company will give you a return of 20% and above monthly. It is absolutely not possible, please in order to be successful and meaningful, avoid pay one and get two.
